definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Motherboard ok - Black screen random
threads.message:
Hello

i got <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, customer said while opening the lid, sometimes it works sometimes not. I tried and most of the time it's black with no apple logo after chemie.... but sometimes it starts, I see apple logo, I see login prompt then it stops.. black screen but Mac still on.

I install motherboard to another <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, it's working fine.

When I connect external display it works.

The screen looks nice, there's no scratches... customer said Macbook didn't fall.

Could this be related to the little board between screen an motherboard ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - Motherboard ok - Black screen random
threads.message:
Very likely flexgate issue.
Inspect backlight flex on T-CON.
Be sure that is the problem, before going on to fix it.
